name: Akash Gaba
summary: Akash Gaba is a seasoned Software Engineer specializing in cybersecurity and cloud solutions, with notable contributions at Armorcode, Expedia Group, and Sophos. Armed with a B.E. from NSIT and expertise in Java, Spring, Spring Boot, AWS, and database technologies, he excels in enhancing system security, scalability, and performance.

project_and_experience.name: Armorcode
project_and_experience.brief: ArmorCode offers an integrated cybersecurity platform that streamlines application security and vulnerability management to enhance security operations.
experience: Developed a configurable data archiving system, converting historical data into Avro format for storage on S3, with integration of crawlers to facilitate querying via Athena.
Implemented a heartbeat system using Redis's TTL to enhance job concurrency management in a distributed system, ensuring robust monitoring of job statuses.

Transitioned job scheduling from CloudWatch to Quartz to improve scheduling capabilities in a distributed environment and created NewRelic and Logz.io dashboards for robust monitoring of various jobs and APIs.

project_and_experience.name: InsurTech Team
project_and_experience.brief: Dedicated team enabling travelers to seamlessly purchase insurance along with various products.
experience: Led the resolution of security vulnerabilities in multiple services, identified by diagnostic tools, enhancing system integrity and reducing potential risks.
Successfully revamped shopping widget content using internal tools, improving user experience and contributing to increased engagement metrics as a part of increased revenue.

project_and_experience.name: SSPM
project_and_experience.brief: Focused on the security posture of Office 365.
experience: Designed and developed a new product from scratch, integrating Azure for security analysis and designing database tables for an alert engine, while also incorporating AWS services such as SQS and SNS.

project_and_experience.name: Cloud Optix
project_and_experience.brief: A Cloud Security Posture Management solution for AWS, GCP, and Azure cloud infrastructure.
experience: Engineered a PDF summary system, delivering weekly data points to over 50,000 users, and enhanced the AWS inventory fetcher system by implementing a configurable retry mechanism and advancing system monitoring and stability.

Executed enhancements and stabilization across multiple projects, resolving issues and refining the AWS fetcher system for greater stability. Developed a configurable exponential retry backoff library and delivered high-quality, maintainable code.

project_and_experience.name: Sales App
project_and_experience.brief: Provided a mobile-app-based solution to the complete sales team hierarchy.
experience: Developed an invoicing system to manage daily sales, incorporating legacy data migration, a new operational dashboard, and payment processing integrations.
Designed an announcement system for the sales team, featuring a dashboard for operational updates viewable on the Android app.

project_and_experience.name: Mibenefits
experience: Developed backend modules, including a stop-loss widget that migrates data from SQL Server to Elasticsearch. Also developed the backend for multiple widgets using PostgreSQL and Elasticsearch, boosting core application functionality.
Optimized database interactions by converting SpringJDBC queries to Spring JPA, achieving a 30% reduction in code complexity.

project_and_experience.name: Armorcode
project_and_experience.brief: ArmorCode offers an integrated cybersecurity platform that streamlines application security and vulnerability management to enhance security operations.

Transitioned job scheduling from CloudWatch to Quartz to improve scheduling capabilities in a distributed environment and created NewRelic and Logz.io dashboards for robust monitoring of various jobs and APIs.

Created a generic JUnit system for testing of parsing logics using parameterized system and Mockito, followed by mentoring and leading the progress of the system. Out of 50 parsers, we managed to write tests for 20 of them, achieving coverage of more than 80% in each.
Created a distributed locking system to overcome duplicate requests in any consumer using Redis.
